body: You are probably providing wrong path parameters. It seems the data is not been read. Could you provide your parameter settings?
I use windows 10 not Ubuntu. The parameter settings and the error's details are shown in the 2 pictures.

Hi,

I encountered the issue on Windows10. In egogesture_online.py, line 106 I had to make the following changes:

Old:
```
def get_annotation(data, whole_path):
    annotation = []
    print("@@@@@@@@@@@@@@", whole_path)

    for key, value in data['database'].items():
        if key.split('_')[0] == whole_path:
            annotation.append(value['annotations'])

    return  annotation

```

New:
```
def get_annotation(data, whole_path):
    annotation = []
    print("@@@@@@@@@@@@@@", whole_path)

    for key, value in data['database'].items():
        tmp_whole_path = whole_path.replace("\\", "/")
        if key.split('_')[0] == tmp_whole_path:
            annotation.append(value['annotations'])

    return  annotation
```

I also encountered the problem.Its because the generated json annotation file lack a "None" gesture annotation for the last frames of every video.
for example ,I add' "Subject02/Scene2/Color/rgb3_218": {"subset": "testing", "annotations": {"label": "None", "start_frame": "1418", "end_frame": "1549"}}, 'in the json file,then for testing 'Subject02/Scene2/Color/rgb3' video ,it will right.
![2021-01-16 20-41-50屏幕截图](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51583088/104812188-8d304e00-583b-11eb-97ff-6b51e2d094e6.png)
